spans.content: CERTAIN DIAGONAL EQUATIONS AND CONFLICT-AVOIDING CODES OF
ABSTRACT. We study the construction of optimal conflict-avoiding codes (CAC) from a
number theoretical point of view. The determination of the size of optimal CAC of prime
and weight 3 is formulated in terms of the solvability of certain twisted Fermat
.We treat the problem of solving the twisted Fermat equations in a more general
situation by allowing the base field to be any finite extension field
greater than a lower bound of the order of magnitude
such that the equation in question is solvable over
able to contribute new results to the construction of optimal CAC of prime lengths and
Keywords: binary protocol sequence, conflict-avoiding code, diagonal equation,Hasse-
A binary protocol sequence set for transmitting data packets over a multiple-access col-
lision channel without feedback is called a conflict-avoiding code (CAC) in information
theory. It has been studied a few decades ago by
\mathrm { \Delta \ f M a t { 9 0 } ] [ N G M 9 2 ] [ G V 9 3 ] [ T R 0 2 ] [ L T 0 5 ] }
Lev07J. A mathematical model for CACs of length
be the additive group of the integer ring
\Delta ( \mathbf { x } ) = \{ x _ { i } - x _ { j } \mid i \neq j \}
is called a codeword. A CAC
is said to be optimal if
its size is maximal among all CACs of the same length and weight. In the case where the
weight is one or two,there is no difficulty to find the optimal size. However,for weights
more than 2, finding an optimal CAC and determining its size is still an open problem.
The first challenge is the case of weight 3. One of the purpose of this note is to treat the
problem of finding optimal CAC's from a number theoretical point of view and contribute
new results to the construction of optimal CAC of weight 3. Thus,all CACs which we
are concerned with will be of weight 3.
In the case of even lengths and weight 3, the problem of constructing optimal CACs
has a complete answer by the work
denote the multiplicative order of 2 modulo a
positive odd integer m. For a CAC of odd length
a multiple of 4 for all the prime divisors
is not divisible by 4 for all
